result.markdown:
---
title: "Statistical Computing - Practical1 (03Feb)"
format: html
editor: visual
---

## Question 1

Find all rows in “airquality” that have missing values. Note that the `airquality` dataset in `R` is always available (just type `airquality` in the console to see it).


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyr)
data <- airquality
sum(is.na(data)) # count how many na rows
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 44
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
colSums(is.na(data)) # find out which cols have na
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Ozone Solar.R    Wind    Temp   Month     Day 
     37       7       0       0       0       0 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Find na rows in ozone
naOzone <- c()
for (i in seq_along(data$Ozone)) {
  if (is.na(data$Ozone[i])) {
    naOzone <- c(naOzone, i)
  }
}
print(naOzone)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1]   5  10  25  26  27  32  33  34  35  36  37  39  42  43  45  46  52  53  54
[20]  55  56  57  58  59  60  61  65  72  75  83  84 102 103 107 115 119 150
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Find na rows in Solar.R
naSolar <- c()
for (i in seq_along(data$Solar.R)) {
  if (is.na(data$Solar.R[i])) {
    naSolar <- c(naSolar, i)
  }
}
print(naSolar)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1]  5  6 11 27 96 97 98
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
clean_data <- data %>% drop_na() # remove na rows
```
:::


### Question 2

#### Temperature


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# find mean, sd, min and Max of the temperature column
meanTemp <- mean(clean_data$Temp) 
meanTemp
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 77.79279
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sdTemp<- sd(clean_data$Temp)
sdTemp
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 9.529969
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
minTemp <- min(clean_data$Temp)
minTemp
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 57
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
maxTemp <- max(clean_data$Temp)
maxTemp
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 97
```


:::
:::


##### Question 2 Temp Calcs using Na.rm = True


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# removing all of the na rows lead to losing Temp values, redoing it to make it more accurate. Keeping the old code for learning purposes.
meanTemp2 <- mean(data$Temp, na.rm=TRUE) 
meanTemp2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 77.88235
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sdTemp2<- sd(data$Temp, na.rm=TRUE)
sdTemp2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 9.46527
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
minTemp2 <- min(data$Temp, na.rm=TRUE)
minTemp2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 56
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
maxTemp2 <- max(data$Temp, na.rm=TRUE)
maxTemp2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 97
```


:::
:::


#### Ozone


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# find mean, sd, min and Max of the ozone column
meanOzone <- mean(clean_data$Ozone)
meanOzone
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 42.0991
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sdOzone <- sd(clean_data$Ozone)
sdOzone
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 33.27597
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
minOzone <- min(clean_data$Ozone)
minOzone
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
maxOzone <- max(clean_data$Ozone)
maxOzone
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 168
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# all na values are in ozone, so redoing it with na.rm will make no difference
```
:::


### Question 3


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
data2<- cars # load cars data set
sum(is.na(data2)) # no na rows
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
Y <- data2$dist
X <- cbind(1, data2$speed)
beta_hat <- solve(t(X) %*% X) %*% t(X) %*% Y # beta estimate
rownames(beta_hat) <- c("Intercept", "Speed")
beta_hat
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                [,1]
Intercept -17.579095
Speed       3.932409
```


:::
:::


### Question 4


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm(Y~X) #check against lm function
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = Y ~ X)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)           X1           X2  
    -17.579           NA        3.932  
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# get the same value = question 3 calc was correct
```
:::
